title: Natural Language Processing
text: Natural Language Processing

title: Spam Detection
text:
This project aims to build a machine learning model to detect SMS messages as spam or ham (non-spam). Spam messages are growing fast in recent years, and they can be risky. So, detecting them is important. This project uses Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods.We test different classifiers. We also use Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique (SMOTE) to fix class imbalance.
We evaluate model performance using metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. Naïve Bayes with TF-IDF and N-gram models(unigram + bigram + trigram) works best. We also build a live demo to show how the model detects spam in real time.(in project code)

title: Employee Retention & Performance Analysis for HR Decision-Making
text:
Employee retention is a critical challenge for organizations, as high turnover rates can disrupt operations, increase recruitment and training costs, and negatively impact team dynamics and morale. Addressing this issue is vital for maintaining a stable workforce and ensuring organizational success. The business idea underpinning this analysis focuses on leveraging data-driven insights to proactively identify at-risk employees and implement effective retention strategies.
This study utilizes the IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance dataset, which includes detailed information related to employee retention across 35 attributes. These attributes span various dimensions such as environmental satisfaction, compensation, and job performance ratings with an “Attrition” variable, indicating whether an employee has left the company, making it an ideal resource for analyzing turnover trends. The importance of this project lies in its potential to address a pressing business problem by combining advanced analytical techniques with real-world HR data. Organizations today face increasing competition for talent, and understanding the drivers of employee attrition is crucial for retaining top performers and maintaining a competitive edge. Through the application of machine learning models such as Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), this analysis aims to build a robust predictive framework for identifying attrition risk. These methods allow us to uncover key patterns in employee behavior, identify influential factors contributing to turnover, and offer actionable recommendations to help HR departments enhance employee retention and overall organizational stability.

title: SUN COUNTRY AIRLINES CASE PROJECT
text: Sun Country Airlines, a regional carrier, is at a pivotal stage in its development, where strategic use of technology and customer data will play a critical role in shaping its future. Therefore, Warnken, Sun Country’s manager, recognizing the limitations of competing solely on price against larger carriers, emphasizes the need for a deeper understanding of customer preferences. His vision is to create unique value propositions, such as vacation packages, that appeal to customers and are diBicult for competitors to replicate. The other manager, Vaughan, she highlights the need to align the online booking channels with the expectations of modern travelers while also driving engagement in the airline’s loyalty program, Ufly Rewards. She aims to refine their digital platforms, making them more user-centric and eBective in converting frequent travelers into loyal members.

title: Projects
text:
Employee retention is crucial for organizational stability, as high turnover disrupts operations and increases costs. This study leverages the IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance dataset, containing 35 attributes like satisfaction, compensation, and performance, to analyze turnover trends. By applying machine learning models—Random Forest, Logistic Regression, and K-Nearest Neighbors—the project aims to predict attrition risk, identify key factors driving employee turnover, and provide actionable insights. Understanding these patterns helps HR departments proactively retain talent, reduce recruitment expenses, and maintain a competitive edge in today’s talent-driven market, ultimately fostering a stable and productive workforce.



This project builds a machine learning model to classify SMS messages as spam or ham (non-spam) using Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques. To address class imbalance, it applies SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique). Various classifiers are tested, and model performance is evaluated using accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. The best results are achieved using a Naïve Bayes classifier with TF-IDF vectorization and N-gram features (unigram, bigram, trigram). A live demo is also developed to showcase real-time spam detection. This project highlights the importance of automated spam detection in the face of increasing spam message volume.



This project explores the complexity of human kissing behavior in romantic relationships, which goes beyond biological instincts to foster emotional connection. It investigates factors influencing “Kiss Frequency,” including partner attractiveness, kiss satisfaction, and broader societal influences like national GDP and the GINI index. The study aims to understand how both personal and environmental factors affect kissing habits. Unlike other animals, humans kiss more frequently in love, and this behavior may vary based on relationship type and surroundings. The analysis offers new insights into the cultural and economic aspects of kissing, with findings detailed in later sections of the report.



This project supports Sun Country Airlines’ growth by using data-driven strategies to enhance customer engagement and loyalty. Using data from January 2013 to December 2014 (37 columns, 26,575 rows), we applied K-means Cluster Analysis and visualized results using Excel, Python, and Power BI. This enabled us to group customers by similar behaviors and preferences, supporting Precision Marketing efforts. Visualizations helped identify key segments and generate actionable insights to strengthen customer relationships and build a sustainable competitive advantage.



This project aims to address the potential issues arising in plant-based market, especially for Beyond Meat. This project provided some suggestions for Beyond Meat in Product and Sales Channel aspects.

title: STATISTICAL DATA ANALYSIS PROJECT
text: We’ve all experienced love, and human behavior towards love is often far more complex than that of other animals. One of the most notable behaviors is kissing. Humans tend to kiss when they are in love, which is not commonly seen in the behavior of other animals. This raises the question: why do people kiss? It’s not just for procreation or the fulfillment of desires but also for forming a deep connection with others, especially in close relationships. In what situations do people tend to kiss more in their relationships? Does the surrounding environment aLect kissing behavior? What kinds of relationships encourage more frequent kisses? We explored the relationship between “Kiss Frequency” and various other factors within romantic relationships, such as the attractiveness of a partner, satisfaction with the kiss, and even some economic metrics including national GDP and the GINI index, which will be discussed in the section 3. We believe that there is complexity in this issue because having evidence to prove that at a country level there is a correlation is something that is not really focused on and was something we did not have much knowledge about before we started this analysis project. By examining these factors, we aim to gain a deeper understanding of how both personal and societal influences shape kissing behavior in romantic relationships. These findings will be explored in detail in the subsequent sections of this report.
